channel.title: BBC Sport

item.title: Have Liverpool missed out on chance to sign Guehi?
item.description: With top clubs in Europe registering an interest, have Liverpool missed out on the chance to sign Crystal Palace and England defender Marc Guehi?

item.title: What's going on with fan disorder at European games?
item.description: Was the disorder of Young Boys fans at Aston Villa an isolated incident, or does it indicate something more prevalent?

item.title: Gueye red card appeal rejected with 'no reason' given
item.description: The Football Association rejected Everton's appeal against Idrissa Gueye's red card without providing an explanation, David Moyes says.

item.title: Chelsea's 'best player' Palmer fit to face Arsenal
item.description: Cole Palmer is available to play for Chelsea against London rivals Arsenal in the Premier League on Saturday.

item.title: Man City want Anderson over Wharton - Saturday's gossip
item.description: Manchester City want Nottingham Forest midfielder Elliot Anderson, Napoli contact Manchester United about Kobbie Mainoo, Sunderland and Newcastle battle for Lazio's Matteo Guendouzi, plus more.

item.title: New Old Trafford included in 2035 World Cup bid
item.description: Manchester United's proposed new Old Trafford stadium is one of 22 venues named in the UK's bid to host the 2035 Women's World Cup.

item.title: O'Neill ready for Celtic farewell on Sunday
item.description: Martin O'Neill expects Sunday's visit to Hibernian to the last game of his temporary return as Celtic manager.

item.title: Late drama in Scotland's DNA after Ukraine draw
item.description: Scotland head coach Melissa Andreatta says her team "never stop" after their last-gasp equalier against Ukraine.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v rapper Kofi Stone
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on rapper Kofi Stone - and AI - with his predictions for this weekend's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: Borussia Monchengladbach frustrated as lucky Leipzig hang on for draw
item.description: Borussia Monchengladbach have a goal disallowed and a penalty overturned as they're held to a goalless draw by RB Leipzig, who miss the chance to close the gap on leaders Bayern Munich to three points.

item.title: Highlights: Queen's Park beat Linlithgow in Scottish Cup
item.description: Queen's Park defeat Linlithgow Rose to reach the fourth round of the Scottish Cup. (UK only)

item.title: Liverpool must 'fight together' through difficult period
item.description: Boss Arne Slot says Liverpool must "fight together" after Wednesday's humiliating 4-1 defeat by PSV Eindhoven at Anfield was the Reds' ninth loss in 12 games - their worst run in 71 years.

item.title: Frank pleased with Spurs' performance despite defeat at PSG
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur manager Thomas Frank is pleased with his side's performance despite losing 5-3 to PSG because they responded well after their defeat to Arsenal at the weekend.

item.title: Hampton wins BBC Women's Footballer of the Year
item.description: England and Chelsea goalkeeper Hannah Hampton is named as BBC Women's Footballer of the Year for 2025, and receives the trophy in a surprise presentation.

item.title: 'Farke probably feels like he is up to his neck in muck'
item.description: In his BBC Sport column, ex-Premier League boss Tony Pulis looks at Daniel Farke's situation at Leeds and explains why the fans' reaction to their form tells the manager he is in trouble.

item.title: Chelsea employee defrauded club out of £200,000
item.description: Assistant treasury manager Claire Walsh admits abusing her role to obtain the money over four years.

item.title: Threats, tears and £800 tickets - how Man Utd are trying to tackle touts
item.description: Manchester United are trying several approaches to combat the problem of ticket touts.

item.title: Veron banned over refusal to form guard of honour
item.description: Estudiantes president Juan Sebastian Veron is banned for six months as his side refuses to form a guard of honour for champions Rosario Central.

item.title: Rangers defensive crisis & wobbly Hearts - Scottish Premiership preview
item.description: BBC Scotland looks at the key talking points going into this weekend's Scottish Premiership card.

item.title: Goalkeeper dilemma & defenders on trial in Lionesses friendlies
item.description: England will end another successful year with two friendly matches - but what changes might we see from manager Sarina Wiegman?

item.title: 'Knife edge' - will Newcastle drop Pope for Ramsdale?
item.description: Newcastle United goalkeeper Nick Pope has made a couple of costly errors recently and "all options are on the table" ahead of the trip to Everton, according to boss Eddie Howe.

item.title: Ten-man Everton stun Man Utd after Gueye sees red
item.description: after Idrissa Gueye is sent off for striking a team-mate, 10-man Everton beat Manchester United to earn David Moyes his first Premier League win as a visiting manager to Old Trafford.

item.title: 'I like when my players fight' - Moyes backs Gueye after red card
item.description: Everton manager David Moyes defends Idrissa Gueye after the midfielder was sent off following an altercation with team-mate Michael Keane, admitting he likes to see his players "brawl" with each other to show they care.

item.title: 'You don't want anyone fighting' - Hart on Gueye red card
item.description: Former England goalkeeper Joe Hart reacts to Everton duo Idrissa Gueye and Michael Keane's clash at Manchester United on BBC Radio 5 Live's Monday Night Club.

item.title: 'Forget the result' - Amorim concerned for Man Utd after defeat
item.description: Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim says he is concerned by the performance of his players after losing 1-0 at home to Everton.

item.title: When team-mates fight - Dyer v Bowyer
item.description: BBC Sport looks back at team-mates Lee Bowyer and Kieron Dyer coming to blows during Newcastle's 3-0 loss to Aston Villa at St James' Park on 2 April 2005.

item.title: Why xG can't always tell us how good a team really is
item.description: If you look at the xG for the Premier League results last week, you would probably be thinking the statistic is a load of rubbish.

item.title: Littlejohn abuse after Cain incident 'disgusting'
item.description: Republic of Ireland manager Carla Ward says abuse directed towards midfielder Ruesha Littlejohn has been "disgusting" and a "disgrace".

item.title: Van Persie gives son debut 'as a coach - not as a dad'
item.description: After Shaqueel van Persie was given his senior debut by his father Robin, BBC Sport picks out other father-son duos in football.

item.title: Boro's manager gamble & popular Millwall - EFL weekend preview
item.description: Middlesbrough's managerial gamble and Millwall the popular underdogs - BBC Sport picks out five highlights from the weekend's EFL schedule.

item.title: Chelsea's Buchanan to help single mums in Canada
item.description: Chelsea defender Kadeisha Buchanan grew up "seeing the hardships and suffering" in a single-parent household and now wants to help others.

item.title: Stack up on Man City stars? The FPL talking point
item.description: FPL expert Pras Singhal and Statman Dave are both in agreement that Manchester City starters are a must for your team.

item.title: The surprise success stories to follow at the World Cup
item.description: An expanded format means a crop of smaller nations has qualified for the World Cup. Here are some of the underdog outsiders looking to defy the odds.

item.title: IFA looking for 'right leader' to replace Oxtoby
item.description: The Irish Football Association says it has "started preparations" to recruit a new Northern Ireland women's senior manager to replace Tanya Oxtoby.

item.title: Hughes - the manager who announced his own sacking
item.description: It is not often a manager announces his own sacking, but that was the bizarre case with David Hughes and Newport County.

item.title: Police 'indiscriminately assaulted' Newcastle fans
item.description: Newcastle United are to launch a complaint following the "unacceptable treatment" of their supporters by French police after their side's defeat against Marseille.

item.title: 'We depend on that DNA' - the next generation of Lionesses
item.description: The Lionesses have won back-to-back European titles but can the youngsters coming through replicate their success?

item.title: The rise of Bayern's 'special' teen Karl who 'plays Messi style'
item.description: In less than 12 months, Lennart Karl has progressed from youth football to the Champions League - and is in contention for a World Cup spot. BBC Sport charts the Bayern Munich teenager's rise.

item.title: Eze hits hat-trick as Arsenal thrash Tottenham
item.description: Eberechi Eze scores a hat-trick to help Arsenal thump rivals Tottenham 4-1 and go six points clear at the top of the Premier League - despite a moment of magic from Richarlison.

item.title: Rogers nets twice as Villa come from behind to beat Leeds
item.description: Morgan Rogers scores a second-half double as Aston Villa fight back to beat Leeds 2-1 at Elland Road and leave Daniel Farke's side in the relegation zone.

item.title: Slot needs to make 'huge decisions' and leave 'some big players out' - Murphy
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Danny Murphy and Joe Hart discuss what Arne Slot needs to do moving forward to get Liverpool out of a tricky time in the Premier League.

item.title: How Eze shone for Arsenal in derby debut
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Danny Murphy discusses how Arsenal forward Eberechi Eze shone in his North London derby debut.

item.title: Rogers' 'confusing' but 'special' free-kick technique
item.description: Match of the Day pundit and former goalkeeper Joe Hart looks at Morgan Rogers' 'confusing' but 'special' free-kick technique.

item.title: Tavernier defiant, but are players good enough to take Rangers forward?
item.description: Rangers captain James Tavernier insists his side can still reach the knockout stages of the Europa League despite taking just one point from their opening five fixtures.

item.title: What's the real cost of cheap, fake football shirts?
item.description: Fake football kits can be as much as £70 cheaper than the real deal, but experts have raised concerns they could be harmful.

item.title: 'Strasbourg aren't Chelsea's feeder club' - inside the multi-club ownership
item.description: Strasbourg president Marc Keller says details how Chelsea combine with his club in a 'smart multi-club' group.

item.title: BBC secures rights to show La Liga clips until 2027
item.description: BBC Sport has secures the rights to show La Liga highlights in the UK in a deal which runs until 2027.

item.title: Load up on Man City, Brentford and Villa - FPL team of the week
item.description: Gameweek 13 is a good time for FPL managers to play their Free Hit chip as they can target struggling sides such as Wolves, Burnley and Leeds.

item.title: Madueke 'not worried' by fan criticism over signing
item.description: Summer signing Noni Madueke says the response from Arsenal fans during games has been "unbelievable".

item.title: As Liverpool hit 'new low' - is Slot's job at risk?
item.description: After a dismal run of form, Arne Slot's job as Liverpool boss is starting to come under question - just six months after winning the Premier League title.

item.title: 'My wife said I'd mess it up' - O'Neill steers Celtic through choppy waters
item.description: A month after being appointed interim Celtic manager Martin O'Neill has steered the club through choppy waters, with their 3-1 Europa League win at Feyenoord another "terrific" result.

item.title: 'It would be the biggest middle finger' - Chilwell eyes World Cup
item.description: Ben Chilwell is keen to show he can go from the Chelsea 'bomb squad' to England's World Cup squad thanks to his move to Strasbourg.

item.title: 'I'm past being angry' - Liverpool look for answers to worst run for 71 years
item.description: Where does another humiliating defeat for Liverpool, making it their worst run for 71 years, leave the club and manager Arne Slot?

item.title: Ronaldo's World Cup reprieve - special treatment or justified?
item.description: Has Fifa given Cristiano Ronaldo special treatment to get the star player to the 2026 World Cup finals, or have we seen this happen before?

item.title: 'Start believing the hype' - how 'effortless' Estevao outshone Yamal
item.description: Estevao Willian outshone fellow wonderkid Lamine Yamal with a wondergoal on Tuesday - so is it "time to start believing the hype"?

item.title: Have Premier League's most expensive signings been successful?
item.description: Which of the Premier League's most expensive signings can be considered a success, or a failure, relative to their achievements?

item.title: Why it was always Arsenal for 'part-time barista' Saka
item.description: England winger Bukayo Saka sits down with Kelly Somers to talk about his love for Arsenal and living in his "coffee era".

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: How to follow the Premier League on the BBC this weekend
item.description: BBC Sport Ask Me Anything explains how to follow the Premier League on the BBC this weekend.

item.title: Which countries are set to win extra Champions League places?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything explains which countries are on course to win extra qualification spots for the 2026-27 Champions League campaign

item.title: A European giant - but what's happened to the modern-day Ajax?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains the demise of Ajax in recent years and whether their fortunes could be about to change

item.title: When were Coventry last in the Premier League?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team take a look at when Coventry City were last in the Premier League and their chances of promotion.

item.title: Why are there 12pm and 2:05pm kick-offs in Premier League on Sunday?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why four kick-offs on Sunday have unusual start times

item.title: Why are Man Utd not playing on a Saturday for two months?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything explains why Manchester United are not playing on a Saturday for two months

item.title: Who is not going to the 2026 World Cup?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at which countries and players will not be competing at the 2026 World Cup

item.title: Four more arrests after alleged assault of Celtic Park steward
item.description: Four further arrests are made in connection with a disturbance at Celtic Park during Falkirk's Scottish Premiership visit on 29 October.

item.title: Real Madrid sorry for Jota and Andre Silva tribute error
item.description: Real Madrid apologise for a mistake in a video paying tribute to Diogo Jota and his brother Andre Silva.

item.title: Mbappe wants £230m from former club PSG
item.description: France captain Kylian Mbappe is seeking £231.5m from Paris St-Germain, with his former club demanding £211m, as their long-running dispute reaches the Paris courts.

item.title: Hamraoui 'forced out of PSG' after iron bar attack
item.description: Former Paris St-Germain midfielder Kheira Hamraoui files a £3m claim against the French club, alleging she was forced out after being attacked with an iron bar.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
